programmes.show_description: (Some of) the best tracks to have soundtracked dance floors over the last 25 years!
6 Music takes you to the dark side with a playlist of the finest goth, electronic and dark pop music, with tracks from Peter Murphy, The Walker Brothers, Yugen Blakrok and PVA.

programmes.show_name: Indie Forever Disco with Beth Ditto
programmes.show_description: Bringing the club vibes to you - wherever you are, whenever you want. Upbeat music to transport you to the dance floor from M83, Radio 4 and Scissor Sisters.
Carefully crafted two hour ambient mix of blissful sounds to transport you into a deep focus.
Ease into your Saturday with AFRODEUTSCHE - the ultimate soft-launch for your weekend. Two hours of deep-listening tracks designed to ground you before the weekend truly begins.
Mark and Stuart present a feast of great music, and comedian Mike Wozniak shares his 'First, Last and Everything' and chats about his latest tour.
Deb Grant sets you up for the weekend with a wild mix of amazing music genres and vibes. Including ace sounds from Cymande, The Revolutionaries, Metallica, Dead Prez and Nick Drake.
Jamz celebrates Lunar New Year with a special show spotlighting East Asian sounds and culture. With Jianbo, Sonia Callico, Oil Club, Byyb Radio, Howie Lee, Tzusing and more.
Gilles shares highlights from his recent trip to the Windy City, including a gospel mix from Tone B Nimble and words from Joshua Abrams, The Bajas, and Jana Rush.

programmes.show_name: The Craig Charles Funk and Soul Show
programmes.show_description: Putting down the Trunk of Funk is Diogo Strausz, a seriously talented Brazilian producer whose latest record nods to the trailblazing 80s Brazilian sound.
Don's Saturday night selections cross time, space and genre. This weekend, he's got new numbers by Reggae Roast, Daniel Avery, Lexa Gates, Invisible System and Kumail.
It's all about the breaks and late-night rollers as SHERELLE soundtracks your Saturday evening...
Up-and-coming producer and junglist SIMMS steps up to the Sweatbox with half an hour of original productions.
20 years on from Mary Anne Hobbs' Dubstep Warz, Rave Forever pays homage to the sound at its peak.
Joy Anonymous select the best tracks to unwind to as well as creating their very own unique ambient mini mix in this Morning After Mix!
A crafted mix of carefully sequenced calm music to straighten you out.
Let AFRODEUTSCHE provide the perfect, low-lit soundtrack for that first cup of coffee, turning your morning into a masterclass in calm.
Mark and Stuart present a feast of great music and chat for weekend breakfast.
Cerys welcomes Steven Price to explore scoring Ocean with Attenborough, and Neil Brand shares insights from the Laurel & Hardy centenary, celebrating their timeless comic legacy.
Guy chats to musician and songwriter Alexander Carson about Lord Byron, piano collecting and tricorn hats.
Iggy serves up a sonic cocktail to soundtrack your Sunday afternoon. This week, he's got key cuts by Smerz, Miles Davis, Zo√© Basha, Richard Hawley and Angel Bat Dawid.
Mary Anne looks ahead to Tracey Emin's landmark exhibition A Second Life,  which opens at the Tate with words from Tate Director Maria Balshaw and Tracey Emin.
Stuart's featured album is Robert Wyatt's 1975 solo album Ruth is Stranger than Richard. Plus Jethro Tull, Sun Ra and Motorpyscho.
Your weekly trip through mystical musical realms guided by Zakia, sharing jazzy selections filled with saxophones and flutes, as well as words from a maestro of both - Shabaka.
